author: Staff Reporter
text:
MahilaCourt Judge Vijayakumari on Friday sentenced a 33-year-old man to undergo 10 years rigorous imprisonment for harassing his wife that led her to committing suicide in 2012.

The prosecution case is that A. Kamaraj of Pagudupattu in Karumandurai was married to Banupriya (23) for 10 months. Kamaraj is an alcoholic and he frequently quarrelled with her demanding dowry from her parents for purchasing motorcycle.

On August 4, 2012, she committed suicide by hanging at her residence.

Based on a complaint, the Karumandurai police registered a case under Sections 306 (abetment of suicide) and 498A (husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty) of IPC and arrested Kamaraj.

The judge found him guilty and sentenced Kamaraj to undergo 10 years rigorous imprisonment and levied fine of Rs. 2,000 for abetting wife’s suicide and also three years rigorous imprisonment and fine of Rs. 1,000 for harassing her. Later, Kamaraj was lodged at Salem Central Prison.
title: TAMIL NADU
